channel.title: Summit Events in 2021 on Open Security Summit
channel.description: Recent content in Summit Events in 2021 on Open Security Summit

item.title: AI ML European regulation
item.description: About this session A Panel discussion about the upcoming European regulation about AI/ML

item.title: ASVS User Stories creation
item.description: About this session Continuing a project started at OSS in 2018, we’ll talk about User stories (what they are and how to write them, and continue the contribution to the ASVS Agile Delivery guide https://github.com/mario-platt/ASVS-Agile-Delivery-Guide with the intent of breaking down into smaller groups and continue development

item.title: ASVS User Stories creation
item.description: About this session Continuing a project started at OSS in 2018, we’ll talk about User stories (what they are and how to write them, and continue the contribution to the ASVS Agile Delivery guide https://github.com/mario-platt/ASVS-Agile-Delivery-Guide with the intent of breaking down into smaller groups and continue development

item.title: CDR API Standard
item.description: About this session Session to cover the topic of creating an API standard for interacting with CDR (Content Disarm and Reconstruction) engines

item.title: For bugs start with a passing test (and 99% code coverage)
Graph based Risk Policy
item.description: About this session Petra and Abbas are going to be presenting the latest version of the Graph-based Risk Framework

item.title: How we achieved SOC2 Type 1 Compliance using Jira
item.description: About this session Petra and Abbas are going to be presenting the how the Glasswall team was able to use JIRA to scale the process of getting SOC 2 compliant

item.title: Managing projects using Github Issues and ZenHub
Positive Security models and Rebuilding into a "Known Good" state
item.description: About this session This session will focus on multiple ways we can implement Positive Security models and how Rebuilding into a “Known Good” state scales.session During the session we will cover areas where these patterns can be applied: Source code Files with business content (Documents, Spreadsheets, Presentations, Pdfs, Images) DevSecOps Config files Cloud Environments Network Traffic

item.title: Secure Access to Kubernetes pods using teleport
item.description: About this session Session to show how to use the Open Source Teleport tool to secure access to Kubernetes pods

item.title: Threat Modeling Glasswall Cloud SDK
item.description: About this session Practical session on Threat Modeling the Glasswal Cloud SDK

item.title: Threat Modeling Glasswall Folder-to-Folder Plugin
item.description: About this session Practical session on Threat Modeling the Glasswall Cloud SDK

item.title: Threat Modeling Using Glamorous Toolkit
item.description: About this session Session on how to create Threat Models using Glamorous Toolkit

item.title: What to do in preparation for a Threat Model
item.description: About this session Petra, Abbas and Chris are going to be presenting the guidance provided to developers before threat modeling sessions

item.title: Workshop on creating C# Tools using the Owasp O2 Platform
item.description: About this session This session will focus on how to use the O2 Platform multiple Platform’s to easily create and deploy tools O2 Platform The O2 platform represents a new paradigm for how to perform, document and distribute Web Application security tests and scripts. O2 is designed to Automate Security Consultants Knowledge and Workflows and to Allow non-security experts to access and consume Security Knowledge In practice the O2 Platform is a collection of Open Source modules that help Web Application Security Professionals to maximize their efforts and quickly obtain high visibility into an application’s security profile.
